item.title: Demo paper submitted: SerPro a Service Programming Application with SRv6
item.description: The INS has made a second paper contribution to the 17th International Conference on Network and Service Management (CNSM) in Izmir, Turkey, on October 25-29, 2021.

item.title: New Semester Thesis - Central Frontend for Segment Routing Applications
item.description: The goal of this thesis is to build the central frontend that is the entry page for all SR-Apps. The landing page will display a near real-time topology of the service provider network.

item.title: New Semester Thesis - SR-App: Green Routing
item.description: The carbon footprint of telecommunication elements is now a topic of increasing concern. Reducing emissions in routing would contribute to the reduction of the total CO<sup>2</sup> emissions in the ICT sector.

item.title: Paper submitted: Dynamic Service Programming with Path Preprocessing
item.description: The INS has contributed to the first international workshop on Network Programmability (NetP), which will be held, in conjunction with the 17th International Conference on Network and Service Management (CNSM), Izmir, Turkey, on October 25-29, 2021.

item.title: Project Tor Vergata/OST: Extending K8s with SRv6 features
item.description: The Cloud Networking team at INS is going to collaborate with the research team of Professor Stefano Salsano at the University of Roma Tor Vergata on a project called Extending K8s with SRv6 features.
